grand theft.definition: theft of property or services whose value exceeds a specified amount or of a specified kind of property (as an automobile)

identity theft.definition: the unauthorized use of another's means of identification (as name or social security number) for the purpose of commiting theft or another crime

petty theft.definition: theft of property or services whose value is below a specified amount called also
petty theft.note: Petty theft is a misdemeanor but may be aggravated by prior convictions.
